programme.desc: Merlin the macaw lands at the clinic for a beak trim and ruffles a few feathers. Dr. Pol responds to an emergency call for an ailing alpaca, and Dr. Lisa pulls porcupine quills from a feisty cow. Dr. Brenda performs an emergency C-section on a Pit bull, as Dr. Nicole is called out to aid a stalled farrowing. Charles hopes that he has a solution for seat-stealing Tater.

programme.title: Ultimate Rivals: Cats vs Dogs
programme.desc: Canines and felines have been living side by side in Africa for hundreds of thousands of years, and they've never really gotten along-not even amongst themselves. Throw the hyena into the mix and they're all nightmare neighbors? Stealing from each other; harassing each other; eating each other's young. Avoidance might be the only way to stay alive. Cats, dogs and the wild-card hyena, all jousting in a free for all for survival.

programme.title: Jaguar: Jungle Icon Of Guyana
programme.desc: A young jaguar is about to embark on the most important mission of his life, : to strike out and find a kingdom of his own. His journey will take him through varied habitats, each with its own cast of animals. Only if he can prove his worth will the jaguar be able to claim his throne in one of the last truly wild paradises on the planet.

programme.title: Cougar V. Wolf
programme.desc: Cougar expert Boone Smith tracks deep into Montana's Bitterroot Mountains in search of evidence detailing the competition between the two biggest predators roaming this stunning winter landscape. His goal: pinpoint the places where cougar-wolf conflicts most often occur by gathering clues about each creatures hunting, feeding and fighting behaviors.

Cats, dogs and the wild-card hyena, all jousting in a free for all for survival.

programme.title: The Incredible Dr. Pol

Dr. Pol is called out to treat five calves that are struggling to grow. Dr. Nicole plucks quills from a curious Chihuahua, and Dr. Lisa treats a cat with a blocked bladder.

programme.title: Jaguars Vs. Crocs
programme.desc: Veteran wildlife photographer Steve Winter and cameraman Bertie Gregory capture the remarkable lives of Jaguars in the Pantanal of Brazil. A mother jaguar teaches her cub survival while a determined male jaguar named Scarface dives headfirst into the river to tackle the deadliest of opponents - 6-foot long caiman. Clever capybaras and playful giant otters stick with their family members to avoid being jaguar dinner.

programme.title: Ultimate Rivals: Cats vs Dogs

Throw the hyena into the mix and they're all nightmare neighbors? Stealing from each other; harassing each other; eating each other's young. Avoidance might be the only way to stay alive. Cats, dogs and the wild-card hyena, all jousting in a free for all for survival.

programme.title: Tiger Queen of Taru
programme.desc: The story of Maya the tigress plays out in a tiger reserve in Tadoba, Central India. Here, Bengal tigers chase wild dogs, fight sloth bears and feud among themselves over bloodlines and territory in never-before seen footage. Maya writes her own rules when it comes to raising a litter, yet motherhood doesn‚Äôt come easy. One thing is clear, Maya will do whatever it takes to secure her bloodline within the Kingdom of Taru.

programme.title: Future Cat
programme.desc: We've seen big cats past and their present, but until now we could never even imagine their future! With cutting edge visual effects, Future Cats explores far-off future challenges that may await the big cats. Leading experts discuss possible extreme planetary scenarios and the adaptations big cats would to need to make in order to survive.

programme.title: The World's Most Famous Tiger
programme.desc: Known as the Queen of Ranthambore, Machli is the most famous tiger in the world. The legendary tigress is a fearsome warrior known for her daring exploits. And she's the mother of an incredible four litters of cubs. .
